dict.acceptation: （表示时间）从…；（表示原因）因为；（表示来源）来自…；（表示分离）与…分离[隔开]；

sent.orig: Papermaking originated in China in the second century B.C. Paper made from linen in the early West Han Dynasty (206 B.C.-24 A.D.) was the world's earliest kind of paper made from plant fibres. By pooling the expertise of craftsmen in papermaking, Cai Lun of the East Han Dynasty (25 A. D.-220 A.D.) succeeded in producing quality paper from linen craps, rags, and used fish nets. Papermaking technology was introduced to the West in the third century.
sent.trans: 公元前2世纪我国发明纸。 而汉初造的麻纸是世界上现存最早的植物纤维纸。 东汉蔡伦集中了工匠们的造纸经验，用麻头、破布、旧鱼网作原料，监造出一批良纸。造纸术从3世纪起传到国外。

sent.orig: A glance from one of the moving swords fell across his eyes and prevented him from seeing the blow.
sent.trans: 挥动的剑发出一道闪光，射向他的眼睛，使他看不到这一重击。

sent.orig: A thousand words from the pen in a stream, but ten thousand li away from the subject.
Before they were replaced by steamships,sailing vessels like Cutty sark were used to carry tea from China and wool from Australia.
sent.trans: 大帆船被轮船代替之前，象卡蒂萨克号这样的大帆船是用来从中国载运茶叶，从澳大利亚载运羊毛的。

sent.orig: By request from the readers, we will give more pages to Letters From Readers.
sent.trans: 应读者请求，我们将为“读者来信”一栏增加更多的篇幅。
